title: Seperate Hostname and IP in Port Scan
author: farosch
body_snippet:
The IP is an important option for Importing connections as often the Hostname is not resolvable if using mRemoteNG thru VPN connections, also being able to scan only the given port range and import ALL open ports from that will be exotic :))

_Originally posted by @aniston in https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/841#issuecomment-423445060_

iterations.description: Port scan results show hostname/IP in a single combined column; the ScanHost model already has separate HostIp and HostName properties but the UI merges them via HostIPorName

notes:
AI triage (claude): Port scan results show hostname/IP in a single combined column; the ScanHost model already has separate HostIp and HostName properties but the UI merges them via HostIPorName
Approach: Split the single clmHost column into two columns (clmHostName and clmHostIP) in the PortScanWindow designer, bind them to the existing ScanHost.HostName and ScanHost.HostIp properties, and update the importer to use HostIp for the connection address when hostname is not resolvable
